description.narrative: 4.1 Promoting Development of China''s Microfinance Industry: The issuance of securitization backed by micro credit companies'' (MCCs'') lending portfolios will effectively help MCCs diversify funding source, improve funding utilization, increase asset turnover, and expand lending business. It will also promote credit rating for MCC originators, improve their market recognition and incentivize them to strengthen risk management 4.2 Increasing Access to Finance for MSMEs: MSMEs play an important role in creating employment and contributing to local economy particularly in frontier regions. Nevertheless, they are under-served by traditional financial institutions. The proposed transaction experiments with FCSC to enable MCCs to have access to the capital markets and to help the MCCs expand credit supply accessible and affordable to MSMEs 4.3 Catalyzing China''s ABS Market: The proposed transaction will catalyze China''s ABS market and improve the efficiency of capital markets in China, by promoting credit ratings and market-standard securitization structuring techniques, by facilitating regulations setting and refining, and by bringing a new asset class, microfinance, to the market 4.4 Demonstration Effect: IFC''s participation in this initiative will demonstrate IFC''s confidence in microfinance industry and China''s capital markets, and IFC''s commitment to supporting the development of China''s financial sector through continuous innovation. It is expected that more MCCs will have access to the capital markets, replicating the structure of this transaction

The contemplated project includes IFCs credit guarantee for and/or purchase of the senior tranche of an asset backed securitization (ABS) to be issued by a special purpose trust that will hold for the benefit of investors a portfolio of eligible micro and small loans originated by Fullerton Credit (Sichuan) Co., Ltd (the Originator or FCSC). The size of the ABS will be up to RMB250 million, and the tenor of it will be up to 2 years. The project is aimed to i) catalyze the ABS market in China; and ii) to support FCSC, a leading micro credit company, to access to sustainable and diversified funding sources, and therefore assist it to expand microfinance business to support more micro, small and medium sized enterprises (MSMEs).
